summary: Following the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, several countries declared periods of mourning as a sign of respect and solidarity. Mexico decreed a three-day mourning period, during which the Foreign Minister was scheduled to attend Kennedy's funeral. Similarly, El Salvador also decreed a three-day mourning period. The Iranian Foreign Office instructed its missions to fly flags at half-mast as part of their observance of a mourning period for the U.S. President. These actions demonstrate the international impact of Kennedy's death and the widespread recognition of his significance on the global stage.
significance: The declarations of mourning periods by various countries highlight the global impact and significance of President Kennedy's assassination. These acts of solidarity underscore the respect and recognition Kennedy held on the international stage, reflecting the widespread grief and shock felt around the world following his death.
